content.overview: Work stress is a major health concern for men. Learn evidence-based strategies to manage workplace pressure and maintain mental wellbeing.

keyStrategies.title: Time Management Techniques
keyStrategies.description: Break large tasks into smaller, manageable chunks. Use the Pomodoro Technique: 25 minutes of focused work followed by a 5-minute break.
actionSteps: Create a daily task list and prioritize using the Eisenhower Matrix
Set realistic deadlines and communicate them clearly
Use calendar blocking to protect time for important tasks
Take regular breaks every 90 minutes to maintain focus

keyStrategies.title: Breathing and Relaxation
keyStrategies.description: Simple breathing exercises can activate your parasympathetic nervous system, reducing stress hormones.
actionSteps: Practice 4-7-8 breathing: Inhale for 4, hold for 7, exhale for 8
Try box breathing: 4 counts in, 4 hold, 4 out, 4 hold
Use progressive muscle relaxation during breaks
Practice mindfulness meditation for 5-10 minutes daily

keyStrategies.title: Workplace Boundaries
keyStrategies.description: Setting clear boundaries protects your mental health and improves work-life balance.
actionSteps: Define your working hours and stick to them
Learn to say 'no' to non-essential requests
Turn off work notifications after hours
Create a dedicated workspace if working from home

warningSigns: Physical symptoms like chest pain or rapid heartbeat
content.whenToSeekHelp: If stress persists for more than 2 weeks or significantly impacts your daily functioning, consider speaking with a mental health professional.

title: Heart Health Basics
summary: Know your numbers: BP, LDL, BMI.

content.overview: Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death in men. Understanding and monitoring key health metrics can help prevent heart problems.

keyMetrics.title: Blood Pressure
keyMetrics.description: Optimal: <120/80 mmHg. High blood pressure is a silent killer that damages arteries over time.
actionSteps: Check your blood pressure monthly at home or pharmacy
Limit sodium intake to <2,300mg daily (1 teaspoon salt)
Exercise regularly: 150 minutes moderate activity weekly
Manage stress through relaxation techniques

keyMetrics.title: Cholesterol Levels
keyMetrics.description: LDL (bad cholesterol) should be <100mg/dL. HDL (good cholesterol) should be >40mg/dL.
actionSteps: Get cholesterol checked every 4-6 years starting at age 20
Eat heart-healthy fats: olive oil, nuts, fatty fish
Limit saturated fats to <7% of daily calories
Consider plant sterols if cholesterol is elevated

keyMetrics.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
keyMetrics.description: Healthy range: 18.5-24.9. BMI >25 increases heart disease risk.
actionSteps: Calculate your BMI: weight(kg) ÷ height(m)²
Aim for gradual weight loss of 1-2 pounds per week
Focus on waist circumference: <40 inches for men
Combine cardio and strength training for best results

lifestyleChanges: Quit smoking immediately - benefits start within 20 minutes
Limit alcohol to 2 drinks per day maximum
Eat 5-7 servings of fruits and vegetables daily
Get 7-9 hours of quality sleep nightly
emergencySigns: Chest pain or pressure lasting more than 5 minutes
Pain radiating to arm, jaw, or back
Shortness of breath with minimal exertion
content.whenToSeekHelp: Call emergency services immediately for chest pain. Schedule regular checkups with your doctor for preventive care.

content.overview: Strength training builds muscle, boosts metabolism, and improves bone density. This beginner-friendly routine requires minimal equipment and time.

warmUp.title: 5-Minute Warm-up
exercises: Arm circles: 30 seconds forward, 30 seconds backward

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
exercises.form: Feet shoulder-width apart, lower as if sitting in chair, keep chest up
exercises.progression: Add 5-10 pounds when 15 reps feels easy

exercises.name: Push-ups
exercises.form: Start on knees or against wall if needed, keep body straight
exercises.progression: Move to standard push-ups, then elevated feet

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.form: Forearms on ground, body straight from head to heels
exercises.progression: Increase hold time by 10 seconds weekly

exercises.name: Lunges
exercises.form: Step forward, lower back knee toward ground, push back up
exercises.progression: Add dumbbells when form is perfect

progressionTips: Increase weight or reps by 5-10% weekly
Focus on form over speed or weight
safetyNotes: Stop if you feel sharp pain
Breathe out during exertion, in during relaxation
Keep core engaged during all exercises
Consult doctor before starting if you have health concerns

content.overview: Quality sleep is essential for physical recovery, mental clarity, and immune function. These evidence-based strategies can improve your sleep quality.

bedtimeRoutine.title: 1-Hour Before Bed Routine
steps: Turn off screens 1 hour before bed (blue light disrupts melatonin)
Do a relaxing activity: reading, gentle stretching, or meditation
Use blackout curtains or eye mask if needed

elements.description: Replace mattress every 7-10 years. Choose pillows that support your sleeping position.
Use earplugs, white noise machine, or fan to block disruptive sounds.
Remove all light sources including LED indicators. Consider a sleep mask.
Keep bedroom well-ventilated. Consider air purifier if you have allergies.

activities: Get sunlight exposure within 1 hour of waking
Avoid caffeine for first 90 minutes after waking
Eat breakfast to regulate circadian rhythm
Get regular exercise but not within 3 hours of bedtime

solutions: Write down worries in a journal
Get up if not asleep within 20 minutes

content.whenToSeekHelp: Consult a sleep specialist if you have persistent insomnia, loud snoring, or excessive daytime sleepiness.

content.overview: Managing blood sugar through diet is crucial for diabetes prevention and control. Learn which foods help stabilize glucose levels.

foods: Nuts and seeds (almonds, walnuts, chia seeds)

swaps.benefit: More nutrients, better blood sugar control

swaps.choose: Water, herbal tea, or sparkling water

swaps.benefit: Natural sugars with fiber and protein

mealTiming.title: Optimal Meal Timing
strategies: Eat every 3-4 hours to maintain stable blood sugar
Include protein with every meal and snack
Eat carbohydrates with fiber, fat, or protein
Avoid large meals that cause blood sugar spikes
Consider intermittent fasting under medical supervision

techniques.description: Fill 1/2 plate with non-starchy vegetables, 1/4 with protein, 1/4 with complex carbs
Protein = palm size, Carbs = cupped hand, Fats = thumb size
Weigh foods for accurate portion control, especially for carbs

bloodSugarMonitoring: Check blood sugar before and 2 hours after meals
Keep a food diary to identify patterns
Aim for blood glucose 80-130 mg/dL before meals
Work with healthcare team to adjust medications as needed
content.whenToSeekHelp: Contact your healthcare provider immediately for high blood sugar or ketones. Regular checkups every 3-6 months are essential.

content.overview: Achieving work-life balance is crucial for mental health, relationships, and overall wellbeing. Small changes can create significant improvements.

strategies.description: Define clear work hours and stick to them
actions: Set specific start and end times for work
Block calendar for personal time
Turn off work notifications after hours
Use commute time as transition between work and home

strategies.description: Control how and when you're available
actions: Set auto-reply for after-hours emails
Use 'Do Not Disturb' mode on phone
Create separate work and personal email accounts
Establish response time expectations with colleagues
Create dedicated workspace if working from home
Pack up work materials at end of day
Change clothes to signal work-to-home transition
Avoid working in bed or personal spaces

techniques.description: Schedule specific time slots for different activities
implementation: Block time for deep work (2-3 hour chunks)
Schedule regular breaks and meals
Reserve time for family and personal activities
Include buffer time between tasks

techniques.description: Categorize tasks by urgency and importance
implementation: Focus on important, non-urgent tasks first
Delegate urgent, non-important tasks when possible
Eliminate or minimize unimportant tasks
Review and adjust priorities weekly
Check emails only 2-3 times per day
Batch phone calls and meetings
Do all errands in one trip
Schedule administrative tasks together

activities: Wake up 30 minutes earlier for personal time
Go for short walks during lunch
Listen to music or podcasts during commute
Create transition ritual from work to home
Engage in hobbies or creative activities
Spend quality time with family or friends

actions: Schedule regular family time (weekly date nights, family dinners)
Be fully present during family activities
Share household responsibilities equitably
Communicate openly about work stress and needs
Schedule regular friend meetups or calls
Join clubs or groups with shared interests
Be supportive during friends' difficult times
Maintain friendships through regular contact
Schedule regular 'me time' for personal interests
Practice self-compassion and self-care
Pursue hobbies and personal development
Reflect on personal values and goals regularly

warningSigns: Loss of interest in activities you once enjoyed
content.whenToSeekHelp: Consider professional help if work-life imbalance persists despite efforts, or if you experience persistent stress, anxiety, or depression.

title: Mental Health First Aid
summary: Recognize and respond to mental health crises.

content.overview: Mental health first aid teaches you how to identify, understand, and respond to signs of mental health and substance use challenges. This knowledge can save lives.

indicators: Withdrawal from friends, family, and activities
Significant changes in sleep or appetite
Increased use of alcohol or drugs
Talking about feeling hopeless or worthless
Expressing thoughts of death or suicide
Talking about being a burden to others

actions: Choose a private, comfortable setting
Use a calm, non-judgmental tone
Express genuine concern
Listen without interrupting
Avoid giving advice or trying to 'fix' the problem

questions: Are you thinking about hurting yourself?
Do you have a plan for how you would do it?
Do you have access to means to carry out your plan?
Have you felt this way before?
What has helped you cope in the past?

actions: Stay with the person if they're in immediate danger
Remove any means of self-harm if safe to do so
Encourage professional help
Offer to accompany them to get help
Follow up regularly to check on their wellbeing

response: Stay calm and don't leave them alone
Remove any weapons or harmful objects
Contact their support network if appropriate
Speak in a calm, reassuring voice
Stay with them until the attack passes

selfCare.title: Caring for Yourself
practices: Set boundaries to protect your own mental health
Seek support from friends, family, or professionals
Don't take responsibility for someone else's recovery
Know your limits and when to step back

content.whenToSeekHelp: If someone is in immediate danger, call 000. For ongoing support, encourage them to see a mental health professional or GP.

content.overview: Prostate health is crucial for men's wellbeing. Understanding risk factors, symptoms, and screening options can help with early detection and prevention.

information.description: A walnut-sized gland that produces seminal fluid. Located below the bladder and in front of the rectum.
Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH), Prostatitis, and Prostate Cancer are the most common prostate conditions.
Prostate naturally grows with age. Most men experience some prostate enlargement after 50.

factors: Diet high in red meat and dairy

signs: Pain in pelvis, hips, or back

tests.description: Doctor feels the prostate through the rectum to check for abnormalities
tests.frequency: Annually for men over 50, or earlier if high risk

tests.description: Measures Prostate-Specific Antigen levels in blood
tests.frequency: Discuss with doctor based on age and risk factors

tests.description: Tissue sample taken if other tests suggest problems

recommendations: Eat plenty of fruits and vegetables
Choose lean proteins over red meat
Include healthy fats (olive oil, nuts, fish)
Consider saw palmetto for BPH symptoms
Zinc and selenium may support prostate health
Vitamin D and E have shown some benefits
Always consult doctor before taking supplements

content.whenToSeekHelp: See a doctor immediately for blood in urine, severe pain, or inability to urinate. Schedule regular checkups starting at age 50, or earlier if you have risk factors.

title: Testosterone and Men's Health
summary: Understanding testosterone's role in men's health.

content.overview: Testosterone plays a crucial role in men's physical and mental health. Understanding its functions, natural decline, and management strategies is essential for overall wellbeing.

information.description: Produced mainly in the testes, responsible for male characteristics and many body functions.
Muscle mass, bone density, sex drive, mood, energy, cognitive function, and red blood cell production.
Testosterone levels naturally decrease by about 1% per year after age 30.

signs: Increased body fat, especially around waist

information.description: Total testosterone, free testosterone, and other hormone levels
information.timing: Best done in morning (8-10 AM) when levels are highest

information.note: Ranges vary by age, lab, and individual factors

information.description: May include LH, FSH, SHBG, estradiol, and thyroid function
information.purpose: To identify underlying causes of low testosterone

methods: Adequate protein intake (0.8-1g per lb body weight)
Healthy fats (olive oil, nuts, fatty fish)

treatments.description: Mimics LH to stimulate testosterone production
treatments.use: Often used with TRT to maintain testicular function

content.whenToSeekHelp: Consider testing if you have multiple symptoms of low testosterone. Start with your GP who can order initial tests and refer to an endocrinologist if needed.

title: Nutrition for Active Men
summary: Fuel your body for peak performance.

content.overview: Proper nutrition is essential for men who lead active lifestyles. Learn how to fuel your body for optimal performance, recovery, and long-term health.

nutrients.recommendation: 1.6-2.2g per kg body weight for active men

nutrients.function: Primary energy source for muscles and brain
sources: Sweet potatoes and other starchy vegetables
nutrients.recommendation: 3-7g per kg body weight depending on activity level

foods: Low fiber to avoid digestive issues
Examples: Oatmeal with banana, Greek yogurt with berries
Examples: Protein shake with fruit, chicken with rice

guidelines: Eat every 3-4 hours to maintain energy

recommendations: Start each day with 500ml of water
Monitor urine color (pale yellow is ideal)
Consider electrolyte drinks for sessions >1 hour
Drink 150% of fluid lost during exercise
Monitor weight before and after exercise

supplements.benefits: Bone health, immune function, testosterone support
Muscle function, sleep quality, stress management

strategies.description: Prepare large quantities of staple foods
examples: Prepare 2-3 cups of brown rice or quinoa
Wash and chop vegetables for the week

mistakes.solution: Track calories to ensure adequate intake for your activity level
Eat within 30-60 minutes after training for optimal recovery
Focus on whole foods first, use supplements to fill gaps
Set reminders to drink water throughout the day
Eat a variety of colorful fruits and vegetables daily

content.whenToSeekHelp: Consult a sports nutritionist or registered dietitian for personalized nutrition plans, especially if you have specific performance goals or dietary restrictions.

content.overview: Financial wellness is a crucial aspect of men's overall health and wellbeing. Building wealth, managing debt, and planning for the future reduces stress and improves quality of life.

strategies.description: Allocate 50% to needs, 30% to wants, 20% to savings
implementation: Track all expenses for one month
Categorize spending into needs, wants, and savings
Adjust percentages based on your situation
Review and adjust monthly

strategies.description: Every dollar has a purpose before the month begins
implementation: List all income sources
Assign every dollar to a category
Track spending throughout the month
Adjust categories as needed

strategies.description: Use cash for variable expenses to control spending
implementation: Withdraw cash for categories like groceries, entertainment
When envelope is empty, stop spending in that category
Use digital envelopes for online spending
Adjust amounts based on actual needs

methods.description: Pay minimums on all debts, extra on smallest balance
steps: List all debts from smallest to largest balance
Pay minimum on all except the smallest
Put extra money toward smallest debt
Repeat until all debts are paid

methods.description: Pay minimums on all debts, extra on highest interest rate
steps: List all debts by interest rate (highest first)
Pay minimum on all except highest rate
Put extra money toward highest interest debt
Continue until all debts are eliminated

methods.description: Combine multiple debts into one lower-rate loan
considerations: Ensure you won't accumulate new debt

tips: Start with $1,000 as a mini emergency fund
Build to 1 month, then 3 months, then 6 months

concepts.description: Diversify investments across different asset classes
Invest fixed amounts regularly regardless of market conditions
benefits: Takes emotion out of investing decisions

concepts.description: Use accounts that provide tax benefits

types.purpose: Protect family if you die unexpectedly
considerations: Term life is usually most cost-effective
Coverage should be 10-15 times your income
Consider length of coverage based on dependents
Review coverage as life circumstances change

types.purpose: Replace income if you can't work

documents.purpose: Specify how assets are distributed after death
considerations: Consider professional help for complex situations

documents.purpose: Allow someone to make decisions if you're incapacitated

mistakes.solution: Build 3-6 months of expenses in liquid savings
Prioritize paying off credit cards and personal loans
Start early, even with small amounts, and increase over time
Protect against major financial risks with appropriate coverage
Save raises and bonuses instead of increasing spending

content.whenToSeekHelp: Consider consulting a certified financial planner for complex situations, estate planning, or if you need help creating a comprehensive financial plan.
